text:
I am applying a function to a column and I want this function to return two resulting columns... something like
```function tst_done(vec) 
    z = zeros(Bool, length(vec))
    for (i, x) in enumerate(vec)
        if !ismissing(x) 
           z[i] = 1 
        else 
           z[i] = 0
        end
    end
    return (z = z, v = z)
end

transform!(a, :Antigen => tst_done)```
where it takes the column `Antigen` and the function `tst_done` will theoretically return two vectors. Anyway to do this? I can always do it manually.

text: make the destination `AsTable` i.e. `:Antigen => tst_done => AsTable`
